unnormalised: Air India, the Maharaja of Indian skies, recently unveiled some major changes in its baggage policy effective from 01/06/2024. The new rules aim to simplify travel for domestic and international passengers, but understanding the details is crucial to avoid any last-minute hassles at the airport.
normalised: Air India, the Maharaja of Indian skies, recently unveiled some major changes in its baggage policy effective from first june two thousand and twenty four. The new rules aim to simplify travel for domestic and international passengers, but understanding the details is crucial to avoid any last minute hassles at the airport.

unnormalised: Firstly, let's talk about domestic flights. Earlier, the free baggage allowance was 25 kg for Economy class. Now, it's been standardized to 20kg across all Economy fares, except for 'Comfort' fares, which retain the 25 kg allowance. Passengers exceeding the 20kg limit will be charged excess baggage fees, starting at approx. Rs. 500 per additional kg. Keep in mind that the maximum weight permitted per single piece of luggage is 32 kg for safety reasons. Anything above that needs to be shipped as cargo.
normalised: Firstly, let's talk about domestic flights. Earlier, the free baggage allowance was twenty five kilogram for Economy class. Now, it's been standardized to twenty kilogram across all Economy fares, except for 'Comfort' fares, which retain the twenty five kilogram allowance. Passengers exceeding the twenty kilogram limit will be charged excess baggage fees, starting at approximately rupee five hundred per additional kilogram. Keep in mind that the maximum weight permitted per single piece of luggage is thirty two kilogram for safety reasons. Anything above that needs to be shipped as cargo.

unnormalised: For international routes, the baggage allowance varies depending on the destination and fare type. To the US and Canada, Economy passengers typically get 2 pieces of baggage, each weighing up to 23 kg (approx. 50 lbs). Business and First Class passengers usually get 2 pieces weighing up to 32 kg (approx. 70 lbs) each. For flights to Europe and the UK, the allowance might be based on weight rather than pieces, often around 20-25 kg in Economy. Always double-check the specific allowance on your ticket or the Air India website, as this can change based on promotions or specific fare rules.

For flights to Europe and the U-K, the allowance might be based on weight rather than pieces, often around twenty to twenty five kilogram in Economy. Always double check the specific allowance on your ticket or the Air India website, as this can change based on promotions or specific fare rules.

unnormalised: Hand baggage rules also have been revised. Passengers are allowed one cabin bag weighing up to 8 kg. The maximum dimensions for the cabin bag are 55 cm x 35 cm x 25 cm. In addition to the cabin bag, one personal item like a laptop bag or a small handbag is permitted. However, liquids, aerosols, and gels (LAGs) in containers larger than 100 ml are generally prohibited in hand baggage for international flights.

However, liquids, aerosols, and gels (L-A-G-s) in containers larger than one hundred milliliter are generally prohibited in hand baggage for international flights.

unnormalised: Sports equipment and musical instruments are subject to special rules. Golf bags, skis, and bicycles may be carried as part of your checked baggage allowance, but they often incur additional handling charges. Musical instruments like guitars or violins can be carried as hand baggage if they meet the size and weight restrictions. Otherwise, they need to be checked in, and it's highly recommended to pack them in a hard case for protection.

unnormalised: Air India offers pre-paid excess baggage options, allowing passengers to purchase additional baggage allowance at a discounted rate before their flight. This can be significantly cheaper than paying excess baggage fees at the airport. Check the Air India website or app for details on pre-paid baggage rates.

It's also a good idea to take a photo of your packed suitcase before heading to the airport, which can be helpful in case of loss or damage. Keeping these guidelines in mind will help ensure a smoother and stress-free travel experience with Air India. Remember to always verify the latest information on Air India’s official website (www.airindia.com) before your travel date, as policies are subject to change.
